Key Match Events: The Los Angeles Lakers experienced a decisive 134-110 loss to the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Cleveland nearly doubled the Lakers' score in the first quarter, 42-23.
Anthony Davis scored 22 points, recorded 13 rebounds, two assists, and two steals.
LeBron James recorded 26 points, six rebounds, and three assists.
Rookie forward Dalton Knecht scored 18 points, recorded three rebounds, and one assist.
Cleveland power forward Evan Mobley recorded 25 points and five rebounds.
Shooting guard Donovan Mitchell recorded 24 points, seven assists, three rebounds, and three steals.
Center Jarett Allen recorded 20 points, 17 rebounds, two blocks, and one assist.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Davis expressed disappointment in the team's offensive performance, stating, 'This is the first game where we regressed and we were god awful offensively.'
LeBron James' record against his first team, the Cleveland Cavaliers, is now 7-3.
